text: Hey there! I’d love to start by hearing a bit about yourself—what brings you to this interview and what you’re most excited about in tech?
Great to have you with us! Could you share a bit about your background—what coursework, projects, or hobbies have shaped your interest in coding and data science?

evaluation.notes: Friendly intro, clear English, confident tone.

text: That sounds intriguing! Can you walk me through one of those AI‑powered social media apps—what tech stack did you use and what were the main challenges you tackled?

evaluation.notes: Good effort, but could use more detail on stack and challenges.

text: Nice! I’m curious about how you structured the data flow—how did you handle the image uploads, AI processing, and voting logic from the client to your backend?

evaluation.notes: Clear explanation, but more detail on backend and API design would help.

text: That sounds like a solid system. Working on projects with multiple moving parts can be tricky—can you describe a time when you had to collaborate with a teammate (or a designer/QA) and how you ensured the feature stayed on track?

evaluation.notes: Good setup, looking for a concrete collaboration example.

text: I see, it’s impressive to see a project through independently. Switching gears a bit—what’s your favorite programming language so far, and why?

Great! Let’s dive into a quick algorithm discussion. Suppose you have an array of integers and you need to find the longest contiguous subarray where the sum of its elements is zero. How would you approach solving this, and what would be the time complexity?
Absolutely, no worries at all! Thanks for taking the time. We’ll keep this note and follow up once you’re available to finish up. Have a great call and good luck!
